sen.j: 佐紀盾列古墳群（さきたてなみこふんぐん）は、奈良市曾布に所在する古墳時代前期中葉過ぎから後半にかけて営まれたヤマト政権の王墓を多く含む古墳群である。
sen.e: The Sakitatenami tumulus group, located in Sofu, Nara City, is a group of tumuli that include many mausoleums of emperors in the Yamato regime operated in the era from the middle to the latter half of the kofun (tumulus) period.

The Sakitatenami tumulus group, located in Sofu, Nara City, is a group of tumuli that include many mausoleums of emperors in the Yamato regime operated in the era from the middle to the latter half of the kofun (tumulus) period.

The Sakitatenami tumulus group, located in Sofu, Nara City, is a group of tumuli that include many mausoleums of emperors in the Yamato regime operated in the era from the middle to the latter half of the kofun (tumulus) period.

sen.j: 佐紀古墳群とも言う。
sen.e: It is also called the Saki tumulus group.
It is also called the Saki tumulus group.
It is also called the Saki tumulus group.

sen.j: 本古墳群は、佐紀丘陵の南斜面に前期後半から中期、つまり4世紀末から5世紀前半にかけて巨大前方後円墳が営まれた。
sen.e: The tumuli in this group include huge keyhole-shaped ones constructed on the south slope of the Saki hill in the period from the latter half of the first half to the middle era of the kofun (tumulus) period, or in the era from towards the end of the fourth century to the first half of the fifth century..

The tumuli in this group include huge keyhole-shaped ones constructed on the south slope of the Saki hill in the period from the latter half of the first half to the middle era of the kofun (tumulus) period, or in the era from towards the end of the fourth century to the first half of the fifth century.
sen.cmt: 不要なピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: The tumuli in this group include huge keyhole-shaped ones constructed on the south slope of the Saki hill in the period from the latter half of the first half to the middle era of the kofun (tumulus) period, or in the era from towards the end of the fourth century to the first half of the fifth century.

sen.j: 200メートル超す巨大古墳が前期後半には3基、中期には4基みられる。
sen.e: Three huge tumuli exceeding 200 m in length were built in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period, and four such tumuli were also built in the middle era of the kofun period.
Three huge tumuli exceeding 200m in length were built in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period, and four such tumuli were also built in the middle era of the kofun period.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Three huge tumuli exceeding 200m in length were built in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period, and four such tumuli were also built in the middle era of the kofun period.

sen.j: これらは、初期ヤマト政権の王墓である可能性が高い。
sen.e: It is highly possible that they are mausoleums of emperors in the early Yamato regime.
It is highly possible that they are mausoleums of emperors in the early Yamato regime.
It is highly possible that they are mausoleums of emperors in the early Yamato regime.

sen.j: 奈良盆地の東南部のヤマト政権誕生に関わりのある纏向遺跡や天理市南部から桜井市にかけて初期ヤマト政権の大王墓を含む大和古墳群・柳本古墳群が5世紀初頭には衰退し、本古墳群が4世紀後半から5世紀前半に巨大前方後円墳を営むようになった。
sen.e: The Oyamato tumulus group and Yanagimoto tumulus group, which include the Makimuku remains related to the birth of the Yamato regime, in the southeast part of the Nara basin, as well as mausoleums of emperors in the Yamato regime, in the area from the southern part of Tenri City to Sakurai City, declines, and huge keyhole-shaped tumuli in this group became to be constructed in the era from the latter half of the fourth century to the first half of the fifth century.

The Oyamato tumulus group and Yanagimoto tumulus group, which include the Makimuku remains related to the birth of the Yamato regime, in the southeast part of the Nara basin, as well as mausoleums of emperors in the Yamato regime, in the area from the southern part of Tenri City to Sakurai City, declines, and huge keyhole-shaped tumuli in this group became to be constructed in the era from the latter half of the fourth century to the first half of the fifth century.

The Oyamato tumulus group and Yanagimoto tumulus group, which include the Makimuku remains related to the birth of the Yamato regime, in the southeast part of the Nara basin, as well as mausoleums of emperors in the Yamato regime, in the area from the southern part of Tenri City to Sakurai City, declines, and huge keyhole-shaped tumuli in this group became to be constructed in the era from the latter half of the fourth century to the first half of the fifth century.

sen.j: しかし、中期末の5世紀後半から末葉になると弱小化してしまう。
sen.e: However, the sizes of tumuli there became smaller in the era from the latter half of the fifth century to towards the end of the same century.
However, the sizes of tumuli there became smaller in the era from the latter half of the fifth century to towards the end of the same century.
However, the sizes of tumuli there became smaller in the era from the latter half of the fifth century to towards the end of the same century.

sen.j: 形においては、撥形前方部がほとんどなくなっている。
sen.e: Their front parts became not shaped in a plectrum.
Their front parts became not shaped in a plectrum.
Their front parts became not shaped in a plectrum.

sen.j: 古墳群の名の盾（楯）列は、周濠の形が盾型をしており、それらが北側に後円部、南側に前方部という位置でそれぞれが平行に、また東西一直線に並んでいる様子を言い表したもののようである。
sen.e: It is likely that the name of tatenami was used because the shape of the surrounding moat was like a shield (tate) and each of the northern part (around the round part of the tumulus and the southern part (around the front part of the tumulus) was aligned in parallel (nami) in a east-west straight line.

It is likely that the name of tatenami was used because the shape of the surrounding moat was like a shield (tate) and each of the northern part (around the round part of the tumulus) and the southern part (around the front part of the tumulus) was aligned in parallel (nami) in a east-west straight line.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。)補足しました。
sen.e: It is likely that the name of tatenami was used because the shape of the surrounding moat was like a shield (tate) and each of the northern part (around the round part of the tumulus) and the southern part (around the front part of the tumulus) was aligned in parallel (nami) in a east-west straight line.

sen.j: 平城遷都後に定着した新しい言葉と推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed that this term became commonly used after the capital was moved to Heijo.
It is presumed that this term became commonly used after the capital was moved to Heijo.
It is presumed that this term became commonly used after the capital was moved to Heijo.

sen.j: 『古事記』では、成務陵は「沙紀の多他那美」（さきのたたなみ）にありとしている。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), it is recorded that the Seimu ryo (mausoleum) is located in " Saki no Tatanami.'
In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), it is recorded that the Seimu ryo (mausoleum) is located in "Saki no Tatanami.'
sen.cmt: 原文に合せて"を'に訂正しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters), it is recorded that the Seimu ryo (mausoleum) is located in "Saki no Tatanami.'

sen.j: どの天皇の陵かで大混乱があった。
sen.e: There was a significant confusion about which imperial mausoleum was which emperor's.
There was a significant confusion about which imperial mausoleum was which emperor's.
There was a significant confusion about which imperial mausoleum was which emperor's.

sen.j: 843年（承和10）3月に盾列陵で二度にわたって山鳴りがし、雷鳴のようだった。
sen.e: In March of 843, mountains rumbled like thunderclaps in two occasions.
In March of 843, mountains rumbled like thunderclaps in two occasions.
In March of 843, mountains rumbled like thunderclaps in two occasions.

sen.j: そのような奇異があったので、朝廷が図録を調べたところ、二つの盾列陵があって、北が神功陵、南が成務陵だと分かったという。
sen.e: Because such a strange phenomenon occurred, the Imperial court referred to an illustrated book and found that there were two tatenami ryo mausoleums, and that the one located in the northern part was the Jingu ryo mausoleum and the one in the southern part the Seimu ryo mausoleum.

Because such a strange phenomenon occurred, the Imperial Court referred to an illustrated book and found that there were two tatenami ryo mausoleums, and that the one located in the northern part was the Jingu ryo mausoleum and the one in the southern part the Seimu ryo mausoleum.
sen.cmt: Court大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: Because such a strange phenomenon occurred, the Imperial Court referred to an illustrated book and found that there were two tatenami ryo mausoleums, and that the one located in the northern part was the Jingu ryo mausoleum and the one in the southern part the Seimu ryo mausoleum.

sen.j: 間違っていた原因は口伝によるものだという。
sen.e: It is said that the error was caused due to oral tradition.
It is said that the error was caused due to oral tradition.
It is said that the error was caused due to oral tradition.

sen.j: 『続日本後紀』。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihon Koki (Later Chronicles of Japan Continued)."
"Shoku Nihon Koki" (Later Chronicles of Japan Continued).
sen.cmt: 括弧の位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihon Koki" (Later Chronicles of Japan Continued).

sen.j: この事件によって、神功陵は「狭城盾列池上陵」、成務陵は「狭城盾列池後陵」として区別されるようになった（『延喜式』）。
sen.e: After this incident, the Jingu ryo mausoleum and the Seimu ryo mausoleum became to be called 'Sasatatanamiike no e no misasagi' and 'Sakinotatanaminoikeshirino misasagi,' respectively, to differentiate them.

After this incident, the Jingu ryo mausoleum and the Seimu ryo mausoleum became to be called 'Sasatatanamiike no e no misasagi' and 'Sakinotatanaminoikeshirino misasagi,' respectively, to differentiate them.

After this incident, the Jingu ryo mausoleum and the Seimu ryo mausoleum became to be called 'Sasatatanamiike no e no misasagi' and 'Sakinotatanaminoikeshirino misasagi,' respectively, to differentiate them.

sen.j: 五社神古墳（現神功陵、276メートル、北方に位置する、前期後半）
sen.e: The 276-m Gozashi-kofun tumulus (the present Jingu ryo mausoleum, located in the northern part and constructed in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period)
The Gozashi-kofun tumulus: 276m, the present Jingu ryo mausoleum, located in the northern part and constructed in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period

sen.j: 宝来山（ほうらいさん）古墳（現垂仁天皇陵、227メートル）
sen.e: The 227-m Horaisan tumulus (the present Emperor Suinin's mausoleum)
The Horaisan tumulus: 227m, the present Emperor Suinin's mausoleum

sen.j: 佐紀陵山古墳（さきみささぎやまこふん、現日葉酢媛（ひはすひめ）陵、210メートル、前期後半、後円部の頂には平たく割った石を小口積みにし、高さ約70センチの石垣を矩形に巡らして内側に土を詰めた壇を造っている。
sen.e: The 210-m Sakimisasagiyam tumulus (the present Hibasuhime's mausoleum built in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period, at the top of the round part of which a platform is provided by piling flatly cut stones in the koguchi-zumi way (so that the smaller side of each stone was placed outside) to make an approx. 70-cm-high rectangular stone fence and by filling the inside with soil.

The Sakimisasagiyam tumulus: 210m, the present Hibasuhime's mausoleum built in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period, at the top of the round part of which a platform is provided by piling flatly cut stones in the koguchi-zumi way (so that the smaller side of each stone was placed outside) to make an approx. 70-cm-high rectangular stone fence and by filling the inside with soil.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。表記訂正しました。
sen.e: The Sakimisasagiyam tumulus: 210m, the present Hibasuhime's mausoleum built in the latter half of the first half of the kofun period, at the top of the round part of which a platform is provided by piling flatly cut stones in the koguchi-zumi way (so that the smaller side of each stone was placed outside) to make an approx. 70-cm-high rectangular stone fence and by filling the inside with soil.

sen.j: 2009年2月に行われた調査によれば、前方部や渡り堤の斜面に葺石が確認されている。
sen.e: According to the investigation conducted in February, 2009, it was confirmed that there were stones covering the slopes of the front part and the banks connecting the tumulus mound with the outer banks..

According to the investigation conducted in February, 2009, it was confirmed that there were stones covering the slopes of the front part and the banks connecting the tumulus mound with the outer banks..

sen.j: その広さは、東西15.7メートル、南北16.51メートルと想定されている）
sen.e: It is supposed that these stones covered an area of 15.7 meters in the east-west direction and 16.51 meters in the north-south direction.
It is supposed that these stones covered an area of 15.7m in the east-west direction and 16.51m in the north-south direction.
